name: Huffman-decompression
body: Huffman-Decompression ===================== As one of final homework assignments in my ICS 211 course, we had to write a Huffman Decompression program. The program was to take in a file that had been compressed using Huffman enocding, and return a file that contained the original contents before compression. The program was written and Java and has been tested to work with *.txt, *.mp3, *.bmp files. It runs from the command line. A sample of the decoding walkthrough can be found on the original homework assignment page located here, under the discussion section. How to Run ==================== First be sure you have the most recent Java JDK installed on your system. Set up your PATH variable. Next, compile all three source files using the javac command. How to use javac Lastly to run the program use the command: java DecompressTest [file name]
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
